programme.title: 100 Women
programme.sub-title: Raid at the Brothel Next Door
programme.desc: It all starts with a friendly voice that offers vulnerable women an opportunity when they need it the most - until the pin drops, and they realise their lives will never be the same. In Spain, both a destination and a transit country for victims trafficked for sex into Europe mostly from Latin America and Africa, an elite group of women investigators are fighting international gangs to liberate women from the sinister trap they are caught in. BBC 100 Women followed them as they engage in round-the-clock surveillance operations and raids, with unprecedented access into the heart of a global crime that is often hidden just in the flat next door.

programme.title: BBC World News America
programme.desc: In-depth reports on the major international and US news of the day presented from Washington DC

programme.title: Jon Richardson: The Knitwit
programme.desc: A stage show, recorded at the Hackney Empire. With his trademark fastidious humour Jon asks all the important questions - will the recycling be put out on the right day, who is going to smooth over the top of the margarine and how many lights are on upstairs when everybody is downstairs?

programme.title: Action Point
programme.desc: DC is the owner of an amusement park where the rides are designed with minimum safety. He has to juggle the arrival of his estranged daughter, Boogie, with a major theme park opening nearby which threatens his business. Comedy based on a true story, starring Johnny Knoxville and Eleanor Worthington-Cox

programme.title: Ramsay's 24 Hours to Hell and Back
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels across the United States in search of restaurants in dire need of renovation - and after analysing their situation, he has just 24 hours to bring them back from the brink of disaster. In the second episode, Gordon and his team arrive at Blend on Main in New Jersey, where they get to work renovating the once popular restaurant which has fallen into decline, leaving the owner and chef Lou Smith $500,000 in debt

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Doug Guller, the CEO and founder of Bikinis Sports Bar and Grill, a restaurant chain known for its scantily-clad waitresses, poses as a reality show contestant and works undercover alongside his staff. With big growth for the business on the horizon, he wants to make sure everything in the organisation is running smoothly

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp takes on food-inspired crafts by creating vegetable-printed greeting cards and trinket dishes made from salt dough

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: War of the Words Season 9, Episode 18
programme.desc: Frederick wins a national spelling competition, but the other entrants' parents claim Frasier helped him by silently mouthing the letters of difficult words - a view shared by the judges. Comedy, guest starring Trevor Einhorn

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Roz struggles to tell Alice her hamster is dead, while Niles and Frasier return to their childhood home and discover what they believe to be evidence of a murder

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: The Love You Fake Season 9, Episode 20
programme.desc: Cam Winston and Frasier decide to suspend hostilities for the sake of their parents, who have supposedly fallen for each other - though their late-blossoming romance could just be a clever subterfuge. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: In Boston for a conference, Frasier and his family bump into many of his former Cheers cronies celebrating Cliff's retirement. Niles is overwhelmed with boredom, but Martin hits it off with Norm - an occasion that promises to cause more than a little embarrassment. Comedy, guest starring Rhea Perlman, George Wendt and John Ratzenberger

programme.title: Cheers
programme.sub-title: The Sam in the Grey Flannel Suit Season 6, Episode 20
programme.desc: Rebecca is astounded to learn Sam has been promoted to an administrative position in the company that owns Cheers - until she realises they only want him to play on the corporate softball team. Comedy, starring Ted Danson and Kirstie Alley

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Woody decides he deserves a pay rise, but is fobbed off with a new, important-sounding job title. Comedy, starring Woody Harrelson

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Rebecca and Lilith throw a party for Carla after she becomes depressed at the prospect of becoming a grandmother. Comedy, starring Ted Danson and Rhea Perlman

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: Shut Out in Seattle - Part One Season 6, Episode 23
programme.desc: Part one of two. Daphne's engagement to Donny leaves Niles feeling down, so he seeks solace in the arms of a younger woman. Frasier keeps getting his girlfriend's name wrong, Martin's relationship with Bonnie turns sour, and Roz cannot bring herself to break up with Bulldog

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: Shut Out in Seattle - Part Two Season 6, Episode 24
programme.desc: Part two of two. Niles and Roz take extreme action to solve dilemmas in their respective love lives. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, David Hyde Pierce and Peri Gilpin

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin and Niles meet the new woman in Frasier's life - and discover to their surprise that she looks just like his mother. Comedy, guest starring Rita Wilson, alongside Kelsey Grammer, John Mahoney and David Hyde Pierce

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: Father of the Bride Season 7, Episode 2
programme.desc: Martin and Frasier inadvertently offer to pay for Daphne's wedding, while Niles sinks into gloom as the marriage approaches and tries to console himself by dating someone new - unaware she is a prostitute. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The station shock-jocks decide to play practical jokes - and Frasier's pompous manner makes him the ideal target for their dubious humour. Starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer is duped into enlisting in the army, and falls foul of a hard-nosed officer who uses him as the target in a training exercise. Escaping back to Springfield with troops in hot pursuit, he makes his way home - where Marge's ingenuity saves the day. With the guest voice of Kiefer Sutherland

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Moe becomes a successful poet with Lisa's help, and wins the approval of a group of highbrow authors - but enjoys the limelight so much that he claims all the credit for himself, prompting her to seek revenge

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Ice-Cream of Margie (With the Light Blue Hair) Season 18, Episode 6
programme.desc: Homer is fired from the power plant and secures a job as an ice-cream man, but gets so wrapped up in his new career that he puts his marriage in jeopardy. Meanwhile, Marge discovers a new skill as an expert sculptor, using an unusual medium - lollipop sticks

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart becomes Nelson's best friend and revels in the protection his new status brings. Unfortunately, the situation means he is unable to see Milhouse - forcing the pair to meet in secret. Meanwhile, Homer becomes addicted to one of Lisa's fantasy books

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The family goes away to Marge's favourite childhood holiday destination, which has unfortunately changed since she was last there. Homer spurs the locals into sprucing the place up, but an exuberant firework display wrecks everything, forcing him to make amends by becoming a fisherman

programme.title: Junior Taskmaster
programme.sub-title: You Can't Milk a Pigeon Season 1, Episode 6
programme.desc: Contestants - all aged between nine and 11 - are on tenterhooks as they compete in the first semi-final. Junior Taskmaster Rose Matafeo scrutinises their every move and loyal assistant Mike Wozniak has even combed his moustache for the occasion. The hopefuls perform a poem about their favourite celebrity and recount some secrets to a milkman called Mark

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first destination of the week is Northlands Farm in Chichester, where host Keith offers the full farm experience and an afternoon of paddleboarding on his very own lake

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Claire hosts the second visit of the week at the Mad Hatters Campsite in Ely, Cambridgeshire. Martha and Lisa love the Wonderland theme but Giovanni and Enzo are not happy with the lack of ensuite

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Lisa and Martha host the third visit of the week at The Redan Inn in Chilcompton, Somerset. The guests love the quirky interiors and breakfast goes down a treat but Giovanni and Enzo get picky about plates

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to The Limes in Maldon, Essex. Hosts Giovanni and Enzo hope their luxurious rooms will impress their guests - and the B&Bers are certainly happy to drink in the additional extras at check-in. They spend the afternoon at nearby Radio Caroline, the famous pirate radio station on a boat in Chelmsford. Breakfast dazzles most of the guests, and Giovanni and Enzo think they're onto a winner

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.sub-title: Fri 20 Oct 2023: Payment Day Season 2023, Episode 65
programme.desc: Payment day sees Keith try to get to the bottom of the concerning cleanliness score that's been bugging him. Lisa and Martha are also keen to uncover why Enzo and Giovanni weren't blown away by their breakfast, before the boys turn the tables to quiz their rivals about some fussy feedback

programme.title: Inside McVitie's at Christmas
programme.desc: One of Britain's best-known biscuit brands gear up for their busiest time of year. Facing an ultra-competitive Christmas market, this programme reveals how McVitie's attempt to stay ahead of their rivals, including a very special twist on the iconic Penguin bar and the creation of a brand-new product - the white chocolate digestive

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.sub-title: The Great Christmas Bake Off 2021 Season 12, Episode 11
programme.desc: Paul Hollywood, Prue Leith, Matt Lucas and Noel Fielding invite the stars from the award-winning hit drama It's a Sin to join them in the famous white tent to celebrate Christmas. Olly Alexander, Nathaniel Curtis, Lydia West and Shaun Dooley compete for the coveted Christmas Star Baker title, before the London Community Gospel Choir perform their version of All I Want for Christmas

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: With sport and weather

programme.title: A Royal Guide To
programme.desc: A look at the Christmas period for the royals, featuring extravagant black-tie dinners, celebrity carol concerts and 20-foot trees. Historically it was a 12-day celebration filled with performances, jousting tournaments and even coronations. Today, however, the royal Christmas is much more down to Earth - even the king enjoys a turkey dinner and an evening of festive telly

programme.title: Alpine Hotel at Christmas
programme.desc: Documentary following the festive season at the Gstaad Palace hotel in Switzerland, as staff and management strive to ensure that guests enjoy the ultimate five star experience. Run by third-generation hotelier Andrea Scherz, whose family have owned it since 1938, the hotel is one of the last in Switzerland to close between the summer season and winter. With rooms costing up to £18,000 per night, the pressure is on to provide a truly first-class Christmas

programme.title: Edward Vs George: The Windsors at War
programme.desc: Part two of two. Tension continues to simmer on the eve of the Second World War, as King George VI and Queen Elizabeth make history as the first British monarchs to visit the USA. Edward stirs further controversy with the release of an explosive memoir in 1951. The estranged uncle to the new monarch, Elizabeth II, watches the coronation on French television. Only in 1970 does a young Prince Charles clandestinely visit the aging Duke of Windsor in Paris to herald a thawing of relations

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: A convicted child-killer of towering height and massive build is condemned to death row, but astonishes the guards with his good nature and miraculous healing powers. They believe the gentle giant is incapable of crime, and emotions run high as they realise there is no hope of overturning his death sentence. Supernatural drama, based on a novel by Stephen King, starring Tom Hanks, Michael Clarke Duncan, David Morse and Harry Dean Stanton

programme.title: Zombieland: Double Tap
programme.desc: A decade after they joined forces, survivors Tallahassee, Columbus, Wichita and Little Rock have become experts in identifying and disposing assorted zombies. They set up their new home in the abandoned White House, but after Little Rock heads to Graceland, the team attempts to save her from a group of super zombies. Director Ruben Fleischer's comedy horror sequel, starring Woody Harrelson, Jesse Eisenberg and Emma Stone

programme.title: Ramsay's 24 Hours to Hell and Back
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels across the United States in search of restaurants in dire need of renovation - and after analysing their situation, he has just 24 hours to bring them back from the brink of disaster. This time, Gordon and the team revamp a Cuban-inspired restaurant in Toms River, New Jersey, owned by Patty and her business partner Jeremey, who has already invested $2,000,000 into the restaurant

programme.title: Undercover Boss Canada
programme.desc: Bellstar Hotels and Resorts has been developing Canadian boutique hotel properties since 2004, and manages a dozen resorts across Alberta and British Columbia, but President and CEO Ed Romanowski wants the company to grow into new markets to attract more customers to the seasonal industry. He disguises himself as a member of the housekeeping team at one of the resorts to learn about the organisation at grassroots level

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Everyone pulls together to create magical memories for Mercedes and the McQueens to cherish, while a Christmas card reveals a connection between two residents and an unlocked door might unveil an affair. Freddie is being pulled in all directions, while Robbie frets about his future with Vicky and one villager wants to move their relationship forward but gets a frosty reaction

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer breaks his jaw in an accident and has to have it wired shut. Unable to speak, he discovers the benefits of listening - but Marge finds it hard to come to terms with his uncharacteristic silence

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug and Carrie decide to renew their wedding vows, but preparations for the ceremony throw up more challenges than anticipated - not least the task of finding a chimp to act as best man

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Deacon's estranged wife tells Carrie she wants to get back with him. Doug isn't sure whether to reveal this new development to his friend - especially as he's just announced he's going away for the weekend with another woman

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles takes a new position as a magazine art critic, prompting a jealous Frasier to respond by launching his own arts show. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: The Dog That Rocks the Cradle Season 7, Episode 5
programme.desc: Martin returns from a friend's funeral upset by how it was conducted, and begins to plan his own memorial. Meanwhile, sacked DJ Bulldog takes the opportunity to embark on an entirely new career - in pizza delivery. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: Frasier

She then boards the impressive vessel that will take her down the River Douro. The cruise delivers her to the architectural wonder of Lamego, Vila Real and the home of Mateus Rose. She even manages to hop over the border to Spain to visit the city of Salamanca. There is plenty of food, drink and local culture on offer on Jane's luxurious cruise, which ends its journey in the capital city of Lisbon

Jane McDonald and friends enjoy the Christmas festivities, farmers Rob and Dave Nicholson from Winter on the Farm have a ball in the snow and The Yorkshire Vet Peter Wright takes care of some very special animals

programme.title: Aldi vs M&S: Who Does Christmas Better?
programme.desc: With competition among supermarkets more intense than ever, food experts compare a number of key products from premium brand Marks & Spencer and discount store Aldi to see which one does Christmas best. The programme also looks at their Christmas ad campaigns and dives into the history of both stores, focusing on how they way they sell Christmas has evolved over the decades

programme.title: The 1970s: Those Were the Days
programme.sub-title: A '70s Christmas: Those Were the Days Season 1, Episode 1
programme.desc: A trip down memory lane revealing what Christmas was like in the 1970s, with contributions from broadcaster Angela Rippon and Slade guitarist Dave Hill and a host of experts and historians. The programme reveals what was served up for dinner, what was on TV, the most popular presents found under the tree and the tunes that topped the charts. Plus, the Hastings from Surrey are challenged to put away their smartphones and immerse themselves in a Christmas of the 1970s, making Christmas decorations inspired by Blue Peter, trying the hit boardgame Mastermind, tackling a frozen turkey, tucking into Tunis cake and finding out how easy it really is to bounce on a space hopper

programme.title: Michael McIntyre: Funny Man

programme.title: Bad Boys II
programme.desc: Two mismatched undercover cops set out to halt an underground gang war and bring down a drug lord attempting to flood the market with a deadly form of Ecstasy. However, a romantic interlude threatens to drive the investigation off course. Comedy thriller sequel, starring Will Smith, Martin Lawrence, Gabrielle Union, Jordi Molla and Peter Stormare

programme.title: Ice Cold in Alex
programme.desc: The crew and passengers of an ambulance become stranded in the Libyan desert and face a perilous journey back to civilisation. Leading the trek is an alcoholic army captain, who vows to remain sober until he has completed the task - but his resolve is threatened by a stranger they rescue who is secretly an enemy spy. Second World War drama, with John Mills, Sylvia Syms, Anthony Quayle and Harry Andrews

programme.title: The Pursuit of Happyness
programme.desc: A determined salesman takes custody of his five-year-old son when his wife leaves him, and secures an unpaid internship with a renowned stockbroking firm. However, the lack of a steady income begins to take its toll on the pair, leading to eviction from their home and a daily struggle to support themselves. Gabriele Muccino's fact-based drama, starring Will Smith alongside his son Jaden. With Thandiwe Newton, Brian Howe, James Karen, Dan Castellaneta and Kurt Fuller

programme.title: Independence Day
programme.desc: A fleet of huge flying saucers launches a devastating and unprovoked attack on Earth. As survivors try to flee the seemingly unstoppable alien invaders, the courageous US president, an ace pilot and a computer genius come up with a plan to take the fight to the enemy and save the human race. Roland Emmerich's sci-fi adventure, starring Will Smith, Bill Pullman, Jeff Goldblum, Mary McDonnell, Randy Quaid, Robert Loggia and Harry Connick Jr

programme.title: Ben-Hur
programme.desc: Falsely accused of treason by his adopted brother, Judah Ben-Hur, a Jewish nobleman and officer in the Roman army, returns to his homeland after years at sea to seek revenge. However, he instead finds redemption. Director Timur Bekmambetov's adaptation of Lew Wallace's 1880 novel Ben-Hur: A Tale of the Christ, starring Jack Huston, Toby Kebbell and Rodrigo Santoro

programme.title: Jack Ryan: Shadow Recruit
programme.desc: A former soldier injured in the line of duty takes up a new career as a financial analyst for the CIA. However, his deskbound position changes to a dangerous undercover assignment when he discovers a plot to destroy the US economy. Spy thriller inspired by Tom Clancy's novels, starring Chris Pine, Keira Knightley, Kevin Costner and Kenneth Branagh, who also directed

programme.title: Man on Fire
programme.desc: A former US government operative battling with an addiction to alcohol is hired as a bodyguard to the nine-year-old daughter of a wealthy businessman in Mexico City. When the girl is abducted, he swears vengeance on those responsible while setting out on a dangerous, revenge-fuelled rescue mission. Action thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Christopher Walken, Radha Mitchell and Dakota Fanning

programme.title: London Has Fallen
programme.desc: World leaders gather in London for the funeral of the British Prime Minister, unaware they have been led into a trap. A terrorist plans to kill them all, and devastate the city, and the only people in a position to stop him are the President of the United States and the indomitable head of his secret service. Action thriller sequel to Olympus Has Fallen, starring Gerard Butler, Aaron Eckhart and Morgan Freeman

programme.title: The SpongeBob Movie: Sponge Out of Water
programme.desc: The cheery sea creature tries to prevent a precious secret formula from falling into the wrong hands - but when it goes missing, the end of the world approaches. SpongeBob and his friends embark on a quest to get it back, which leads to them developing superpowers and venturing onto dry land. Animated comedy, with the voices of Tom Kenny and Antonio Banderas

programme.title: The Adventures of Tintin
programme.desc: A reporter's purchase of a model ship brings him under threat from a ruthless criminal, as it is one of a series of clues to the location of the real vessel, which holds a pirate's lost treasure. He sets off on a globetrotting quest to find it, assisted by a drunken sea captain, two bumbling detectives and his faithful dog. Steven Spielberg's animated adventure based on Herge's comic-strip series, with the voices of Jamie Bell, Andy Serkis and Daniel Craig

programme.title: The Northman Interview Special
programme.desc: Alexander Skarsgard, Anya Taylor-Joy and director Robert Eggers talk about making their Viking adventure

programme.title: The Great Escape
programme.desc: The most rebellious Allied prisoners of war are sent to a supposedly escape-proof maximum-security detention camp during the Second World War. They plan an ingenious mass breakout by digging a tunnel, but even when free of the camp, making it across occupied Europe proves a dangerous journey. Drama, starring Steve McQueen, James Coburn, Donald Pleasence, James Garner, Charles Bronson and Richard Attenborough

programme.title: GI Joe: The Rise of Cobra
programme.desc: When a powerful experimental weapon is snatched by a mysterious terrorist organisation, two of the soldiers guarding it are recruited into a top-secret military strike force. As they go in search of the stolen technology, they uncover a plot by its creator to take over the world. Action adventure, with Channing Tatum, Sienna Miller and Christopher Eccleston

programme.title: The Northman Interview Special
programme.desc: Alexander Skarsgard, Anya Taylor-Joy and director Robert Eggers talk about making their Viking adventure

programme.title: Fisherman's Friends
programme.desc: A music executive heads out to a Cornish fishing village on a mission to recruit a group of 10 local fishermen into recording an album of sea shanties. He struggles to win over the unlikely boy band and their families, but begins to gain a new appreciation for their traditional values. Comedy, starring James Purefoy, Daniel Mays and Tuppence Middleton

programme.title: Black and Blue
programme.desc: A rookie cop finds herself targeted by corrupt police and gangsters when she witnesses a drug dealer's murder. She teams up with the one person from her community who is willing to help her, as she tries to escape both the criminals out for revenge and the police who are desperate to destroy the incriminating evidence. Crime drama, starring Naomie Harris, Tyrese Gibson and Frank Grillo

programme.title: The Outsiders
programme.desc: A teenager from the wrong side of the tracks leads a high-school gang in a revenge battle with the city's rich kids who caused the death of a friend. Francis Ford Coppola's drama, with Matt Dillon, C Thomas Howell, Tom Cruise, Patrick Swayze, Ralph Macchio, Emilio Estevez and Rob Lowe

programme.title: The Man from Colorado
programme.desc: An American Civil War veteran, twisted by his experiences during the conflict, becomes the judge of a small town. He embarks on a reign of terror, ruthlessly misusing his power, and it falls to an old friend from his army days to bring him down. Western, starring Glenn Ford, William Holden, Ellen Drew and Ray Collins

programme.title: Anne of the Indies
programme.desc: A no-nonsense pirate welcomes a French captain on board her ship and promptly falls in love - unaware the charming officer has been sent by the British to capture her. Learning of the deception, she kidnaps his wife to sell as a slave. Jacques Tourneur's high-seas adventure, starring Jean Peters, Louis Jourdan, Debra Paget and Herbert Marshall

programme.title: Dr Who and the Daleks
programme.desc: The eccentric time-traveller journeys to the Daleks' home world, which has been devastated by their nuclear weapons. He enters their city and finds them engaged in a plot to exterminate their peaceful humanoid enemies the Thals. Sci-fi adventure based on the TV series, starring Peter Cushing, Roy Castle, Jennie Linden and Roberta Tovey

programme.title: Goodbye Christopher Robin
programme.desc: Biopic of children's author AA Milne, focusing on how his relationship with his son influenced the creation of the Winnie the Pooh stories. The books prove immensely popular in a nation recovering from the trauma of the First World War, but bring the youngster who inspired them uncomfortably into the public eye. Starring Domhnall Gleeson, Margot Robbie and Kelly Macdonald

programme.title: Little Women
programme.desc: Four sisters are raised by their strong-willed mother while their father is away fighting in the American Civil War. Although one yearns to become a writer and another dreams of being married, the girls remain firmly united as the family steers a course through hard times and tragic events. Period drama, based on Louisa May Alcott's novel, with Winona Ryder, Susan Sarandon, Claire Danes, Samantha Mathis and Kirsten Dunst

programme.title: The Northman Interview Special
programme.desc: Alexander Skarsgard, Anya Taylor-Joy and director Robert Eggers talk about making their Viking adventure

programme.title: Infinite
programme.desc: A man who finds himself troubled by memories that are not his and developing skills he never learned is recruited by a mysterious organisation. The members of this group have learned to access the experiences of their past lives, but one has gone rogue, and must be stopped in his efforts to end the cycle of reincarnation by destroying all human life. Sci-fi thriller, starring Mark Wahlberg and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.title: Memento
programme.desc: An insurance investigator suffers from short-term memory loss after an attack in which his wife was also raped and murdered. Unable to remember events for more than a few minutes, he is determined to track down the killer and relies on copious note-taking and reminders tattooed on his body to aid his mission. Christopher Nolan's thriller, starring Guy Pearce, Carrie-Anne Moss, Joe Pantoliano and Mark Boone Jr

In the kitchen, Mrs Patmore thinks she may have found a way to help Daisy cope with her studies, while Thomas' devious ways look set to scupper Baxter's friendship with Molesley. programme.desc: The B&Bers are still in Cornwall for the week's second visit, at The Llawnroc Hotel, where former Redcoats Craig and Rachel know what it takes to keep their guests entertained

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&Bers spend a third consecutive visit in Cornwall, at ex-military man Jo's The Olde Malthouse in Tintagel, where a number of B&Bers are wowed by the heritage charm

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week takes the B&Bers to Sherborne in Dorset, and The Britannia Inn, run by husband-and-wife team Lee and Hannah. Doubts about the décor get things off to a bad start for a handful of guests, while the controversial pricing at breakfast leaves Kirstie questioning whether she's getting enough bang for her buck

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.sub-title: Payment Day, Fri 10 Mar 2023 Season 2023, Episode 25
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. Kirstie and Joe from Cedarwood Holidays want to know why not all of their guests would return to their place, before Craig and Rachel ask why not a single B&Ber would choose to stay at theirs again. Jo from The Olde Malthouse is keen to mop up his cleanliness complaints, while Hannah and Lee from The Britannia Inn have a gripe with Jo in particular. They then learn the identity of the winner

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Compilation edition, looking at how emergency responders must have the ability to constantly adapt to rapidly changing situations. Paramedics are called to a house fire with reports of people trapped inside, and a young man is having back-to-back seizures, which are proving difficult for the medics to treat. Plus, a young boy pulling stunts on his bike falls and smashes his teeth

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Thirty-year-old Chris is admitted after sustaining a potentially life-threatening wound during a game with his friend Jack, who fired the inside shaft of a ballpoint pen into his abdomen using an air rifle. College student Lennon has injured his head after jumping into a door frame while kicking a balloon, while 74-year-old Stafford arrives at A&E because his internal cardiac defibrillator keeps shocking him

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Long-distance lorry driver Neil, 52, has fallen backwards off a ramp onto a concrete floor and is sent for an urgent CT scan, the results of which are a shock. Also receiving treatments are 29-year-old Ben, who has dislocated his shoulder in a cycling accident, and Wendy, 73, who is in resus with a severe open ankle fracture after falling at home

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: The medics race to patients injured on beaches and rivers. A boating accident on the Norfolk Broads leaves holiday-maker Carol with a partially amputated foot, and 15-year-old Robbie needs urgent care when he falls from a coastal cliff in South Shields

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Some of the cases paramedics are faced with when the holiday season is in full swing. In Nuneaton, the team is called to a 17-year-old who has been injured on a rugby pitch

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Thirty-year-old Chris is admitted after sustaining a potentially life-threatening wound during a game with his friend Jack, who fired the inside shaft of a ballpoint pen into his abdomen using an air rifle. College student Lennon has injured his head after jumping into a door frame while kicking a balloon, while 74-year-old Stafford arrives at A&E because his internal cardiac defibrillator keeps shocking him

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Long-distance lorry driver Neil, 52, has fallen backwards off a ramp onto a concrete floor and is sent for an urgent CT scan, the results of which are a shock. Also receiving treatments are 29-year-old Ben, who has dislocated his shoulder in a cycling accident, and Wendy, 73, who is in resus with a severe open ankle fracture after falling at home

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: David and Megan Penny from Gloucestershire search for a holiday home in the Axarquia area of southern Spain, where they can enjoy a laid-back lifestyle with their dog. Property expert Laura Hamilton helps them in their endeavours

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.sub-title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces: Winter World Tour Season 1, Episode 1
programme.desc: George is joined by designer, craftsman and maker Will Hardie on trips to Norway, Finland, the Alps and Canada to check out some amazing winter designs - from ice hotels to stunning modern homes. Along the way, the duo build an igloo, race toboggans, feed reindeer and dodge a bear

programme.title: Ugly House to Lovely House with George Clarke
programme.desc: In the last series, Howard Evans and Prue Chiles helped reworked midwife Mandy's 1980s house, transforming the ugly exterior and first-floor living area. Now George revisits Nottingham's Park Estate to find out if Mandy has managed to complete the transformation and make the ground floor equally as spectacular

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.sub-title: Leamington Spa and Mellor Season 4, Episode 3
programme.desc: Albert and Kristina have moved into a coach house in Leamington Spa which was last decorated in the 1980s with a mock medieval style. With a baby on the way, the couple are desperate to make their new home into something special - so George kicks off by knocking a huge hole in the ceiling for extra headspace. Will his other ideas prove just as exciting? The architect also visits a 200-year-old farmhouse on the edge of the Peak District, where he faces difficulties as the owners are reluctant to let him knock down any walls

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Business consultant James Herbert hosts the first dinner party in Lichfield, Staffordshire, and has high hopes that his guests - football coach Tim Travers, sales assistant JP Goodyear-Martinez, businesswoman Amanda Smith and retired mental-health nurse Ronnie Imlah - will enjoy his complex Italian menu

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Retired mental-health nurse Ronnie Imlah hosts the second dinner party in Lichfield, Staffordshire, hoping her menu inspired by dishes she has eaten at friends' events will win her the £1,000. A revelation by the host leaves her companions in shock, and two guests fail to see eye-to-eye on plastic surgery

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: JP Goodyear-Martinez hosts the third dinner party in Lichfield, Staffordshire, where he treats his guests to a mix of Jamaican food, tight Lycra outfits and a drag queen. However, James Herbert's rendition of Queen's Bohemian Rhapsody does not go down too well with fellow diner Ronnie

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Football coach Tim Travers hosts the fourth dinner party in Lichfield, Staffordshire, and is determined to prove his culinary skills, despite never having cooked before. He tackles an American-themed menu with the help of his mother, but discovers the hardest task is keeping the peace at the table

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Recruitment consultant Amanda Smith hosts the final dinner party in Lichfield, and hopes to impress with a well-executed, sophisticated menu. However the night is not to everyone else's liking and an accident at the table leaves her guests in hysterics, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first destination of the week is Fountain Cottage in Bellingham, Northumberland. The hosts are hoping their award-winning cafe will give them the edge

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Georgia and Paul invite the B&Bers into The Shuckburgh Arms in Stoke Doyle. The guests are amazed by the converted barns but things hit a snag when not everyone sleeps soundly. Michael complains of a broken fridge disturbing his slumber but by feedback time, Georgia and Paul are confident they've done enough to be victorious on payment day

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&Bers are in Great Yarmouth to visit Stu and Lou's Beachside Holidays. A boat trip brings the group together but a dirty discovery brings down the mood, leaving the hosts concerned about their chances of success on payment day

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to the Alice in Wonderland-themed Hatter's Hotel in Skegness, Lincolnshire. Husband-and-wife team Dee and Gary reckon their unique B&B experience will have their guests grinning like Cheshire cats - and the literary décor certainly proves a hit

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers, before discovering who has won the competition. Michael and Danielle from Fountain Cottage aren't happy with one set of B&Bers who declined a return visit, while The Shuckburgh Arms' Georgia and Paul get the 'snooze blues' about one guest's complaint

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Five cooks from in and around Harrogate, North Yorkshire, battle to win the £1,000 prize in the culinary contest. First to take on hosting duties is farm girl Jane Steele, who hopes a combination of innovative recipes and fancy wine will win over her guests - horse enthusiast Cassy Bell, photographer Simon Meyer, country gent Alasdair Moore and adventurous punk and cupcake seller Cathy McConaghy

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Horse enthusiast Cassy Bell hosts the second dinner party in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, hoping her jockey-themed evening and gastro-pub menu will be enough to win her the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cathy McConaghy hosts the third dinner party in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, where she decides to return to her Irish roots and serve a menu of home-made soda bread, cockle soup, oysters, roast lamb, and stout-infused sticky toffee pudding as she vies for the £1,000 prize. However, not all of her guests are impressed with the choice of food being dished up

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Photographer Simon Meyer is the fourth dinner-party host in Harrogate, North Yorkshire. He takes a laid-back approach to the task, but his chicken soup starter goes down so well the guests' comments leave him struggling to retain his composure

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Country gent Alasdair Moore hosts the final dinner party in Harrogate, and hopes to impress his guests with his specially selected wines and 'proper' menu. While his monkfish is well received, an early slip-up dents his confidence, and a risky parlour game does not endear him to farm lady Jane Steele. As the evening progresses, his competitors rate their experience, before the winner of the £1,000 cash prize is announced

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: The East Anglian Air Ambulance crew fight to save their patient's partially amputated hand in Stowmarket and a crew in High Wycombe to help a man in cardiac arrest. The Essex and Herts Air Ambulance team deal with Becky's badly broken ankle in Chelmsford and in Hatfield, a motorcyclist suffers multiple injuries after a collision with a van

programme.title: The Emergency Ward
programme.desc: A critically injured patient is flown in after his horse threw him from the saddle, and a 21-year-old motorcyclist has crashed into a car

programme.title: Inside the Bomb Squad
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of the British Army soldiers who defuse bombs in the UK, providing an insight into the training they receive at 'Bomb School' in Bicester. Sergeant Alex 'Swansea' Hughes is called out at night to a woodland near Clitheroe, where a dog walker has found an explosive dating back to the Second World War. Swansea must make it safe by taking it to a large open field and blowing it up. Sergeant Sam Jones - a veteran of Afghanistan - has seen a spike in the number of calls the bomb squad receive in the UK due to the craze of magnet fishing. Treasure hunters hurl large industrial weights into lakes and canals but often get more than they bargained for, pulling out all manner of potentially deadly explosives including mortar bombs and hand grenades, with one man causing a major incident by disposing of a grenade in a dustbin on the industrial estate where he works

programme.title: Inside the Bomb Squad
programme.desc: Sergeant David 'Podders' Podmore is called out to investigate after a shooting in the Liverpool area, and following a raid at a property, a number of weapons are seized, including a potential improvised explosive device made out of industrial fireworks. Meanwhile, Sam Jones and Matt Coogan head to the scene of a mortar bomb discovery, while Sergeant Alex 'Swansea' Hughes is called to Llandudno, where a magnet fisherman has taken a mortar that he's found to work

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: The East Anglian Air Ambulance crew fight to save their patient's partially amputated hand in Stowmarket and a crew in High Wycombe to help a man in cardiac arrest. programme.desc: Twenty-year-old Antonio is rushed to A&E after a motorcycle accident leaves him with a severe fracture to his leg and the medical team are concerned about a potential arterial bleed. Meanwhile, doctors investigate the damage to the chest and lungs of 40-year-old Karen, who fell off her horse, which then trampled on her, while leukaemia patient Hayley, 29, comes to St George's with wife Emma after suffering an infection and low immune system

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies helps Cheshire couple Alison and Stephen find a holiday home in the charming town of Marseillan in the south of France. With a budget of £115,000, they're spoilt for choice, but will they go for a stunning marina apartment, or a town house with a fantastic roof terrace that's been reduced by nearly £30,000?

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp joins jewellery-maker Rachel Jeffrey to help a soon-to-be-married couple create their own wedding rings, and learns how gold can revive an old picture frame at little cost

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Kent retirees David and Donna Bradley want to relocate permanently to Menorca, so Laura Hamilton shows them five properties for their £300,000 budget

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: Guest-house owners in Spain hope their music event will not attract the local police. In France, a motorhome rental business deals with damaged vehicles and the owners of a holiday village in Portugal deal with an unfortunate leak

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Max McMurdo and Henry Cole visit a motorbike fan, making table lamps from engines and turning a pallet and iron wheels into a stylish modern coffee table

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head east to Newark in search of their latest upcycling prospects. Simon finds an antique European threshing board, which he turns into a coffee table, and Henry's all at sea with a ship's porthole

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Master mechanic Fuzz Townshend and parts-blagging petrolhead Tim Shaw rescue more classic cars. In Kent, they pick up a very tired 1991 VW T4 Campervan. The vehicle's owner has recently had cancer of the brain and his wife hopes Tim and Fuzz can help bring a ray of light to his life

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first venue of the week is Daisy Bank Camp in Hebden Bridge, Yorkshire, where guests take a trip to a local conservation farm and enjoy a locally sourced breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.sub-title: The Lion and Swan Season 2023, Episode 32
programme.desc: The B&Bers visit Katie and Jess' The Lion and Swan in Congleton, Cheshire and while first impressions are good, the cracks soon begin to show as Andrew and Angie are driven insane by the traffic and Emma is unimpressed by the price tag at breakfast. With plenty of grumbles from their guests, will Katie and Jess be pleased with their feedback?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Visit three is to The Three Hills, Cambridge. Hosts Emma and Emily are hoping the award-winning food will be enough to guarantee their success but things get off to a rough start with some cleanliness concerns. After an afternoon out punting and a brilliant breakfast, the hosts feel confident but their joy is short lived when the feedback comes in

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Darren and Jamie look to lay on a magical experience for the B&Bers in the week's final visit, at their wizard-themed Hotel of Wizardry in Great Yarmouth. The guests are certainly spellbound by the hotel's quirks to begin with, but the magic soon wears off when they find that not everything is quite as it should be

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.sub-title: Payment Day, Fri 23 Mar 2023 Season 2023, Episode 35
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. Angie and Andrew from Daisy Bank Camp want to shed a light on some facilities faults, The Lion and Swan's Katie and Jess pour cold water over some kettle confusion, while Emma and Emily from The Three Hills want two B&Bers in particular to open up on their comments about a lack of space. After the dust has settled, they then learn the identity of the winner

programme.title: Narrow Escapes
programme.desc: On the River Lea, florist Roka is waiting for her tulip bulbs to appear on the roof of her boat, while a couple and their assistance dogs open a dog treat business on the towpath

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend take on one of their most obscure cars to date - a little-known Cannon trials competition car. Car trialling is the world's second oldest motorsport, taking specially adapted cars up steep slippery hills and through thick mud courses. It was huge in the 1950s and '60s, but less well known today

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend travel to Devon to fix up one of the fastest road cars of its time, a 1997 Mitsubishi Evo 4. In the 1990s, the Evos dominated the World Rally circuits and the two litre road going versions were no less impressive, making it one of the most extreme cars available for purchase. The car that Tim and Fuzz are taking on belongs to 60-year-old Gary, a petrolhead who loved his Evo and used it as his daily driver

programme.title: A Lake District Farm Shop
programme.sub-title: A Lake District Farm Shop at Christmas
programme.desc: Tebay's staff and its army of local producers are working hard to make a magical Christmas for customers. Head Butcher Dave Morland has a key role, as customers come in their droves to buy their table centrepieces and holiday essentials. Staff members also have their work cut out handling the increase in travellers, and this year Tebay is offering a wide array of speciality artisan and craft products, from delightful hampers to delicious gifts

programme.title: Matt Baker: Travels with Mum & Dad
programme.desc: Part two of two. Matt, Mike and Janice visit North Yorkshire's fairytale coastal village of Robin Hood's Bay as it prepares for its Christmas festival. programme.title: Matt Baker: Our Farm in the Dales

programme.title: Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets
programme.desc: In the 28th century, two special operatives (Dane DeHaan, Cara Delevingne) race against time to save the diverse city of Alpha from a dark force that also jeopardizes the future of the universe.

programme.title: Automata
programme.desc: During a routine investigation involving robot manipulation, an insurance agent (Antonio Banderas) at a robotics company makes a discovery that has profound consequences for the human race.

programme.title: The Big Bang
programme.desc: The search for a boxer's missing girlfriend and diamond fortune leads a detective (Antonio Banderas) to a reclusive billionaire and a physicist who want to recreate the Big Bang.

programme.title: Sharktopus
programme.desc: Genetically engineered, a monster that is half-shark and half-octopus goes on a killing spree.

programme.title: Jersey Shore Shark Attack
programme.desc: Underwater drilling off the Jersey Shore attracts dozens of hungry sharks to the crowded beaches during the Fourth of July weekend.

programme.title: Earth's Final Hours
programme.desc: Government agents try to find a lost satellite network that is the world's only hope for survival after dense matter from an imploded white hole hits the Earth.

programme.title: Molly Moon and the Incredible Book of Hypnotism
programme.desc: London orphan Molly Moon (Raffey Cassidy) must outwit a crook who wants to get his hands on her hypnotism book.

programme.title: Bridge to Terabithia
programme.desc: A boy (Josh Hutcherson) and his new friend (AnnaSophia Robb), the class outsider, create an imaginary world in which they rule as king and queen.

programme.title: The Princess Bride
programme.desc: A storybook stableboy turns pirate (Cary Elwes) and rescues his beloved (Robin Wright), who is about to marry a dreadful prince.

programme.title: The Unbearable Weight of Massive Talent
programme.desc: Facing financial ruin, actor Nick Cage accepts $1 million to attend a wealthy fan's birthday party. Taking on the role of a lifetime, he soon finds himself channeling his most iconic and beloved characters to save himself and his loved ones.

programme.title: Bangkok Dangerous
programme.desc: On a mission to carry out a series of contract killings, a hit man (Nicolas Cage) becomes a street punk's unlikely mentor and begins a tentative romance with a shop girl.

programme.title: Lord of War
programme.desc: A relentless Interpol agent tracks an arms dealer (Nicolas Cage) trying to stay one step ahead of his business rivals.

programme.title: USS Indianapolis: Men of Courage
programme.desc: After their ship is torpedoed by a Japanese submarine, the crew members of the USS Indianapolis face a harrowing nightmare as their ship goes down in the shark infested Philippine Sea.
